titleStmt.title: The confined lover. No prison like to Cupids goal, where some confined be, when sighs and tears cannot prevail, to purchase liberty: till tender females do apply a balsom to the wound; some lovers live, some sighing dye, and so the world goes round. To the tune of, The charms of love.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, at the sign of the Rainbow near Davids-Inn in Holbourn,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Verse: "Ah! how powerful is her charming eye,".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
